meanings.definition: A small peg or plug for stopping the vent of a cask.
meanings.sent1: I used a spigot to close the opening of the barrel.
meanings.sent2: The spigot on the wine barrel was leaking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorns in the spigot.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a spigot, uncontrollable and infectious.
meanings.sent5: The spigot in the dam held back the rushing water with ease.

meanings.sent1: Mom turned the spigot to fill the watering can.
meanings.sent2: The spigot in the kitchen sink was dripping.
meanings.sent3: The cat pawed at the spigot, expecting water to magically appear.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed from him like water from a spigot, non-stop.
meanings.sent5: The spigot in the garden hose sprayed water everywhere when turned on.
